intro: Saccolabium guamense, commonly known as the Guam tamarisk. It is a flowering plant native to the island of Guam in the Marianas archipelago. The plant belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in coastal and sandy environments, often found in dry, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
